instruction_text:
To troubleshoot Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) errors:

1. Note the error code:
   - Record the STOP code displayed (e.g., 0x0000007E)
   - Note any error message
   - Check QR code if present (links to Microsoft support)

2. Check Event Viewer:
   - Event Viewer (eventvwr.msc)
   - Windows Logs > System
   - Look for critical errors around crash time
   - Check for driver or hardware errors

3. Check minidump files:
   - Location: C:\Windows\Minidump
   - Analyze with WinDbg or BlueScreenView
   - Identify problematic driver or module

4. Check recent changes:
   - Review recently installed software
   - Check for driver updates
   - Note any hardware changes
   - System Restore to before issues started

5. Update drivers:
   - Focus on graphics drivers (common cause)
   - Update chipset drivers
   - Update network drivers
   - Update BIOS/UEFI firmware

6. Check hardware:
   - Run memory diagnostic: mdsched.exe
   - Check disk health: chkdsk C: /f /r
   - Test RAM with MemTest86
   - Check for overheating

7. Check disk errors:
   - Command Prompt as Administrator
   - Run: sfc /scannow (System File Checker)
   - Run: DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
   - Check disk for bad sectors

8. Remove problematic software:
   - Uninstall recently added programs
   - Remove conflicting antivirus
   - Check for incompatible software

9. Check for Windows updates:
   - Install all pending updates
   - Check for optional updates
   - Some BSODs are fixed by updates

10. Boot in Safe Mode:
    - Hold Shift while clicking Restart
    - Troubleshoot > Advanced Options > Startup Settings
    - Boot in Safe Mode
    - Test if BSOD occurs in Safe Mode

11. Check BIOS/UEFI settings:
    - Reset BIOS to defaults
    - Check for overclocking (disable)
    - Verify hardware settings
    - Update BIOS firmware

12. Check hardware connections:
    - Reseat RAM modules
    - Check cable connections
    - Verify hardware is properly seated
    - Test with minimal hardware

13. Disable automatic restart:
    - System Properties > Advanced
    - Startup and Recovery > Settings
    - Uncheck 'Automatically restart'
    - This allows seeing full BSOD message

14. Check specific error codes:
    - 0x0000007E: Driver or hardware issue
    - 0x0000001A: Memory management error
    - 0x00000050: Faulty hardware or driver
    - 0x000000D1: Driver issue
    - Research specific code for your error

15. Use Windows Recovery:
    - Boot from Windows installation media
    - Choose Repair your computer
    - Use System Restore or Reset

16. Contact support with information:
    - STOP code
    - Minidump file analysis
    - Recent changes made
    - Hardware specifications
